business.headline: Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

US Gold Card visa expensive, not worth it for Indians: Top law firm bossRishabh Shroff, partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said Donald Trump's $5 million US Gold Card visa does not make sense for Indians as cheaper alternatives are available.

Why are the richest 1% leaving India? Law firm boss Rishabh Shroff explains Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, shared insights into the rising trend of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) acquiring foreign passports and moving their wealth abroad.

Pay is based on capability, not gender: Avarna Jain on pay gap in music industryAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Avarna Jain, Vice Chairperson of Saregama, spoke about the role of women in the workforce and addressed the long-debated issue of pay parity in the music and entertainment industry. She stated that in creative fields, women are leading the way, and pay is determined by ability and capability, not gender.

Place of TV will never be taken away: Anu Ranjan on OTTs replacing TVAnu Ranjan, President of The Indian Television Academy, said that television will remain relevant despite the rise of OTT platforms at the India Today Conclave 2025. She explained that while digital streaming services are growing, they cannot replace television, mainly due to affordability and accessibility.

Conclave 2025: Women leaders on breaking barriers, challenges and leadershipAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, stated that businesses should be evaluated based on numbers, not gender. Speaking at the session "Breaking Barriers and Building Legacies," Thapar stressed that success in business depends on financial results, not whether a man or woman runs it.

Dalal Street logs best week of 2025. Will positive momentum continue?After a long spell of selling, investors on Dalal Street have finally got some relief. But does this mean the worst is over? Here is all you need to know.

Businesses should be judged by numbers, not gender: Namita Thapar International Women's Day: Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, highlighted how financial results remain the key factor in business success, regardless of whether a man or a woman runs the company.

Women investors outpacing men in mutual fund investments: ReportThere's a common belief that women prefer safer investments, but the data challenges that view. More women are actively investing in mutual funds and surpassing men in key areas.

These 3 money deadlines you can't miss in March 2025If you want to secure better returns, deposit in these special fixed deposits, which are available only for a limited period. The last date for investing in these schemes is March 31, 2025.

Bengaluru's housing rent crisis triggers online debate. Details hereA recent social media post has ignited debate over Bengaluru's soaring rents, with users sharing how housing costs are outpacing salaries and making city living unaffordable.

ad:tech New Delhi unveils ad:techHonours to recognise marketing tech innovationHeld on March 6 at Yashobhoomi, in collaboration with the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter, this event brought together industry leaders to honour the innovators shaping the future of tech-driven marketing.

How women investors are winning the race on Dalal StreetWomen are proving to be more disciplined investors, staying invested for longer periods and making better financial decisions. Their patience and careful approach often lead to higher returns compared to men.

Sebi warns Nestle over breach of insider trading regulations: ReportThe Indian arm of Swiss food giant Nestle said its compliance officer received an administrative warning letter from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) on Thursday.

Multiple PANs can attract Rs 10,000 fine. Here's how to avoid  Holding multiple PANs can complicate tax filings and financial transactions as different transactions are recorded under different PANs, resulting in errors, incorrect tax calculations, and possible scrutiny.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as US tariff uncertainty keeps market on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 7.51 points to end at 74,332.58, while the NSE Nifty50 added 7.80 points to close at 22,552.50.
Donald Trump's US Strategic Bitcoin Reserve. All you need to know With this executive order, President Trump reinforces his commitment to make the US the 'crypto capital of the world.'

Explained: Why incorporating in India is the best decision for startups in 2025 Kunal Bahl, co-founder and former CEO of Snapdeal, believes that incorporating in India offers multiple advantages, including better funding opportunities, tax benefits, and easier compliance.

Looking for tax benefits under Section 80C? Check these 5 optionsThe contributions made to the Public Provident Fund qualify for tax deductions under Section 80C and the interest earned, along with the maturity amount, is tax-free.

Reliance share price jumps 3% today. Good time to buy stock?Reliance stock price: The company's stock was up 3.41% to Rs 1,251.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:56 am. However, it is still down over 20% compared to its 52-week high of Rs 1,608.95.

What is EPFO 3.0? 5 key things you can expect While inaugurating EPFO's Telangana zonal office and regional office in Hyderabad, Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya mentioned that the upgraded system will bring EPFO's services closer to a banking experience.

Race against time: What's India doing to deal with US reciprocal tariffs?With US reciprocal tariffs kicking in on April 2, the government is reportedly considering tariff cuts on key imports while companies across sectors engage with American partners to safeguard their businesses.

Blinkit, Zepto to raise commissions as quick commerce battle intensifies: ReportZepto has been steadily hiking commissions for both users and brands, focusing on unit economics, while Blinkit is rolling out a variable commission model.

Is the bull market dead? Ace investor Shankar Sharma cautions investors for 2025When questioned if small investors can bear losses like experienced traders, Sharma said that all successful investors once started small but grew by overcoming challenges.

Good news from GCCs: Hiring set to outpace IT firms for second year in a rowWith global businesses continuing to expand their operations in India, GCCs (Global capability centres) are expected to play a bigger role in the job market, as per experts.

Tariff uncertainty clobbers US markets, Nasdaq crashes 10%, S&P slidesStocks fell even though President Trump offered a one-month reprieve from his 25% tariffs on many goods imported from Mexico and Canada. That's unlike the bounce stocks got the prior day from his giving a one-month exemption specifically for automakers.

India to monitor negotiations before taking a call on US tariffs: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is currently in the United States for discussions, and India will wait for the outcome before taking a stance.
L&T introduces one-day paid menstrual leave for women employeesThe announcement was made by Chairman and Managing Director S N Subrahmanyan during an event held to mark International Women's Day.

Bitcoin prices fall 5% after Donald Trump orders US strategic reserveBitcoin prices dropped over 5% a day before Donald Trump is set to meet with top executives from the cryptocurrency industry at the White House.

Gold loans under scanner as RBI plans stricter norms for lenders: ReportThe RBI wants banks and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) to conduct deeper background checks on borrowers and verify the ownership of the gold being pledged.
DA hike? Will central government employees receive good news before Holi?The government reviews DA twice a year; the January hike is announced around Holi, while July revision is around Diwali.

5 special fixed deposits offering up to 8.05% interest. Check details  These fixed deposits are available only for a limited period, with the last date for investing in these schemes being March 31, 2025.
Sensex rises 600 points, Nifty nears 22,550 as auto and metal stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 609.86 points to close at 74,340.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 207.40 points to end at 22,544.70.

Britannia Industries CEO Rajneet Singh Kohli resignsKohli submitted his resignation on March 5, 2025, and the Board of Directors has taken note of it through a circular resolution passed on March 6, 2025. He will be relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on March 14, 2025.

You don't need employer's permission for these EPF account changesIf your UAN is already linked to Aadhaar, you can update personal details like name, date of birth, gender, nationality, parents' names, marital status, spouse's name, date of joining, and date of leaving, all without submitting any documents.

Sensex gains 600 points: Why is stock market rising despite early losses?Stock market gains: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 475.17 points to 74,205.40, while the NSE Nifty50 added 171.30 points to 22,508.60 as of 2:20 PM.

Infosys mandates 10-day office attendance, to track compliance: ReportInfosys has informed its technology workforce that a new system will track attendance and limit the number of work-from-home (WFH) days they can apply for.

Indian jewellers worry as Trump's reciprocal tariffs spark job loss fears: ReportKey Indian exports to the US include cut and polished diamonds, studded gold jewellery, plain gold jewellery, lab-grown diamonds, and silver jewellery.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 2nd straight day: Is D-Street ready for a bull run?The two-day recovery rally on Dalal Street, though encouraging, comes amid global uncertainty, particularly concerns over a possible trade war. While some experts remain cautious about calling this a full-fledged market recovery, they acknowledge that conditions are improving for a potential uptrend.

entertainment.headline: Shawn Mendes honours Virat Kohli, wears Team India jersey at Mumbai show. WatchSinger Shawn Mendes impressed fans with his debut India performance on March 8 at the Lollapalooza Mumbai show. During the concert, the singer delighted fans by wearing Virat Kohli's Team India jersey.

Zahan Kapoor reflects on celebrityhood, Kapoor legacy and Black Warrant's successActor Zahan Kapoor opened up about his career, his latest Netflix show, Black Warrant, his famous cousins, and more, at the India Today Conclave 2025 held in New Delhi on Saturday.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

The Electric State review: Russo Brothers' dystopian film sparks and fizzles outReleased-Fri Mar 14, 2025The Netflix film, 'The Electric State' falls short of entertainment. Ruby review: A debut album that's ambitious, polished, and unapologetically Jennie Blackpink's Jennie's debut solo album, Ruby, is a bold exploration of her musical identity, featuring 15 tracks that delve into themes of empowerment and self-discovery.

Meghan Markle's With Love, Meghan renewed for season 2 amid criticismThe Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle, has announced a second season of her Netflix series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on the OTT giant on March 4.

general news.headline: India's tariff cuts align with past trade pacts, not Trump pressure: SourcesAccording to sources, the development is seen as part of India's move to significantly reduce its average applied tariffs to key developed countries like Australia, the United Arab Emirates, Switzerland and Norway under a series of recently-concluded bilateral trade agreements.

Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar admitted to AIIMS after chest pain: ReportVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was taken to AIIMS around 2 am on Sunday after experiencing uneasiness and chest pain, reports said.

J&K government under fire for land given 'free of cost' to ex-Sri Lanka cricketerAccording to reports, former Sri Lankan cricketer Muttiah Muralitharan's company, Ceylon Beverages, has been allotted 25.75 acres for a Rs 1,600 crore bottle-filling and aluminium can-manufacturing unit in Kathua district.

Sorry Shinde sahib: BMW driver's apology after urinating at Pune traffic stopGaurav Ahuja, caught on video urinating at a Pune traffic stop, recorded an apology before his detention, vowing never to repeat the act.

India Today Group unveils AI popstars by Stage Aaj Tak at Conclave 2025 At India Today Conclave 2025, the India Today Group's Stage Aaj Tak introduced two AI popstars — Aishan and Ruh — with an aim to blend technology and culture for times when AI is increasingly going to play a key role in our lives.

Journalist killed in UP's Sitapur: Bike hit, then shot three times on highwayReportedly, the incident happened when the assailants first rammed into his bike and then shot him three times. It was first seen as an accident but was soon turned into a murder case after doctors at a district hospital discovered three bullet wounds on his body.

Man gets out of BMW, urinates at traffic stop in Pune; cops take actionOne person was detained after a viral video showed a youth urinating at a Pune traffic junction from a BMW. The main accused is absconding, and police suspect both were intoxicated.

Madhya Pradesh man kills wife, hangs himself; grandfather jumps into his pyreA man in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district died by suicide by jumping into his grandson's funeral pyre. Earlier, the grandson had killed his wife and hanged himself. Police are investigating the motive behind the killing.

Regardless of what happens in the Champions Trophy final, Rohit deserves to carry on until the 2027 World Cup. However, if he decides to step away, he can do so knowing that his vision will endure.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
